Detailed Description

Specific definition of a Lattice General Purpose I/O block of IP used in demos.

This class inherits from the generic Device class to provide the actual read/write methods. The class needs a RegisterAccess object (the Driver Interface) to pass to the Device class for the hardware access.

The GPIO block contains the following registers:

  • 0x00 ID register = 0x12043010
  • 0x04 Scratch pad register
  • 0x08 16 Segment LED register
  • 0x0a 8 DIP switch inputs
  • 0x0c counter control register
  • 0x10 counter current value register
  • 0x14 counter reload value register
  • 0x18
The GPIO provides a means to verify access to hardware by reading the fixed ID register, writing and reading and verifying the scratch pad, and changing the LED display to provide positive real-tiome feedback. The counter can also be used to demonstrate hardware operation independent of software access (32 bit down counter clocked at 125MHz)

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

GPIO::GPIO (  const char *  nameStr,
uint32_t  baseAddr,
LatticeSemi_PCIe::RegisterAccess *  pRA
) 
 

Construct access to a Lattice Demo GPIO IP module. Register access to the IP in the FPGA device is through the Driver Interface object instantiated to access the real hardware and do reads/writes.

The base class Device is initialized to the base address and register size.

Parameters:
nameStr the name of the FPGA device for unique naming
baseAddr the physical bus address the device registers start at
pRA pointer to a RegisterAccess object for accessing the hardware

Definition at line 50 of file GPIO.cpp.

GPIO::~GPIO (   )  [virtual]
 

Destroy the GPIO IP module. The device should no longer be accessed using any methods. All references to the device will now be invalid.

Definition at line 67 of file GPIO.cpp.

Member Function Documentation

uint32_t GPIO::getCounter (  void   ) 
 

Read the 32bit Counter register value. The counter is a 32bit down-counter, which starts at the reload value and counts down to 0. It can restart if the mode is set to reload.

Returns:
the 32 bit counter value

Definition at line 129 of file GPIO.cpp.

References LatticeSemi_PCIe::Device::read32().

uint8_t GPIO::getDIPsw (  void   ) 
 

Read the 8bit value produced by the DIP switch positions. A 1 = switch in up position, 0=down bit d0=Sw1:4, bit d7=Sw2:1

Returns:
the 8 bit DIP switch register value

void GPIO::LED16DisplayTest (  void   ) 
 

Test the LED segments by first lighting each segment, then turning them off. The display the characters "LATTICE*" in order ending with '*'. If PCIeAPI runtime=verbose then print the actions to stdout.

Definition at line 176 of file GPIO.cpp.

References setLED16Display().

void GPIO::runCounter (  bool  run  ) 
 

Start or stop the 32 bit down counter in the GPIO IP module. The counter starts counting down from the value set by setCounterReload().

Parameters:
run true to start down counter, false to stop it.

Definition at line 158 of file GPIO.cpp.

References LatticeSemi_PCIe::Device::write8().

void GPIO::setCounterReload (  uint32_t  val  ) 
 

Write the 32bit Counter Reload value. This is the value that gets loaded into the down-counter when it reaches 0.

Parameters:
val reload value.
Returns:
true if successful; false if error

void GPIO::setLED16Display (  char  c  ) 
 

Display an ASCII character on the display. The proper segments are lit to display the ASCII character.

Parameters:
c character to display, visible range is: 0x21-0x7f

Definition at line 280 of file GPIO.cpp.

References LatticeSemi_PCIe::Device::write16().

void GPIO::setLED16Display (  uint8_t  num,
bool  on
) 
 

Light a single LED segment. The LED segment specified by num is either turned on or off. The other LEDs are not effected.

Parameters:
num LED segment number: segA = 0, segU = 15
on true to turn on, false to turn off

Definition at line 260 of file GPIO.cpp.

References LatticeSemi_PCIe::Device::read16(), and LatticeSemi_PCIe::Device::write16().

void GPIO::setLED16Display (  uint16_t  val  ) 
 

Light the segments of the 16 segment display. Each bit in val controls an LED segment. A 1 turns is on. A 0 turns it off. Layout on the board: bit d15 = segU, d0=segA (see board wiring diagram)

Parameters:
val the 8 bit value to control all 8 LEDs at once
